website_summaries.verdict: Best option on the market for new professionals and amateurs alike.
pros: Full kit that has everything you need to get started, including three pads for cutting, polishing and finishing
Ergonomic, lightweight design that includes vibration reduction

customer_reviews.title: The results I achieved with this system were amazing. Especially considering it was my first attempt
customer_reviews.text: First off I want to say I've never polished a car or used a DA polisher. I purchased this and decided to try it out on my black 2011 Ford Edge Sport. Started with McGuire's ultimate polish followed by Black Light. The results I achieved with this system were amazing. Especially considering it was my first attempt. There isn't a swirl to be found.
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Dont bother with this product it is junk.not good as an orbital as the torque is to low and as a polisher forget it sorry I wasted my time and money. Went back to my real buffer. I have been painting and buffing cars for 20 years just for some perspective. I am not new.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Mirror-Like Finish
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more thrilled with my purchase of the TORQX polisher. 13 hours to 4-step polish my 2007 crew-cab black chevy Silverado 1500 that had years of neglect. Completely worth the money. The pictures speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bourne

customer_reviews.title: It works amazing even before someone who has never done anything like this
customer_reviews.text: I have never used any type of polisher before. I watched hours and hours of chemical guys how to videos. I got this kit and used the VSS scratch and swirl remover, then used blacklight then jet seal and finished out with wet butter wax. I washed and clay bared before starting. The results left me speechless. They took my wife's 2011 Ford edge that had never been washed directly or cared for properly before and turned into show quality.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a while ago from a friend. Loved it so much I bought another one for $99.99 from Amazon and it came with hex pads and v32-38. I'm not a pro so the Torqx is excellent for beginners who have no idea what to do. It's simple and self explanatory with videos on YouTube to show you how to use it. It may not be as strong as the other Torq lines but it isn't necessary for the weekend warrior. Would strongly recommend this to any first timer polisher.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: It worked but parts started flying off.
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving this polisher a one star because it does or did work great. While polishing the side of my car the pad and backing plate came off, or more like flew off. Looking it over it looks like the threads in the nut on the polisher stripped out on to the backing plate. I never even had the backing plate off. This was my first day using the polisher as it came from box to car. I was almost done polishing too. Are there replacement parts from Torq to fix this I wonder?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This DA sucks... I used it twice .... worked good the first time... after that it lost its power to rotate even with the lightest pressure... not happy at all... if you are looking for a decent DA look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: save me

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this back in July during a lightning deal and finally pulled it out to use on my car with some free time. On the fourth 1-2 foot square section on my hood it popped and died. Was doing a decent job until then too. Totally let down, was only using the very light compound that came with it. Now I have a terrible product that isn’t even useful as a paperweight. Doubt I can get a replacement now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding DA Polisher and Polish Kit
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS POLISHER! I was new to paint correction when I purchased this and I couldn't be happier. It's incredibly easy to use, especially after viewing the Chemical Guys how-to videos. I've slowly converted all of my car care products to Chemical Guys. They are great and so is this polisher.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS KIT
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS KIT! It cuts down the time it takes to detail the car and makes it effortless. I've only had it for a short while, but have used it multiple times. The only somewhat negative thing I would mention is that it gets a little warm if you do more than one car, but it is not HOT or dangerous. I can't speak on washing the pads because I opted to purchase replacements instead of cleaning them. The towels are nice, soft, and effective. This is a MUST HAVE for any car enthusiast or entrepreneur.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Yoon

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working literaly a month later
customer_reviews.text: bought it on Feb 21, 2018. not even a month and the polisher started to fail. Looks like the on/off switch or the cable are defective....waste of money. and i can't get a hold of anyone for costumer support.
customer_reviews.author: German J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buffer and Polish
customer_reviews.text: This kit has been a delight to use so far! I've buffed out several different vehicles, ranging from grandpa's old Mercury Grand Marquis to our brand new Toyota Highlander. The polishes and pads almost seem fool-proof and have managed to remove some minor surface defects from all our cars. If you've never used a DA buffer on a vehicle it may at first seem a bit intimidating, but the results are well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dayna J. Rupp-kilgore

customer_reviews.title: but I actually love it. Great products and the smell plesent too
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a few detailing forums and people give the Vline a hard time, but I actually love it. Great products and the smell plesent too. The DA is also good but I haven't owned any others so I have nothing to compare it too. Only complaint is I wish the sail for the speeds was either harder to change or placed elsewhere. I change the speed sometimes by mistake when I hold it a certain way. Kinda noisy but I don't know how much quieter a DA can be.
customer_reviews.author: Dingus Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Great random orbital for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Did a full polish on my car this weekend. Performed great and gave me very noticeable results. My only complaints would be 1st the speed selector is very easily moved while in operation. I accidentally changed the RPM while maneuvering, but its easily noticed and adjusted back. secondly, would be the location of the power switch at the end but its really not that bad. Lastly the location for the vents for the motor are on the end sides of the handle. that's where I tend to grab it, but again an easy adjustment of my hand position. Overall the "problems" I have aren't that big at all. Still gave me great results and worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Speed&Angels

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with results
customer_reviews.text: Machine is very heavy duty and powerful. So far it has done everything I expected out of it. I even bought more of the compounds that came with it, they are excellent products and I will stick with them.
customer_reviews.author: trimpey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent machine!
customer_reviews.text: The polisher is great. I can’t complain about it at all other than the fact that it gets really hot, really fast. Even when not in use and is plugged to the power source it is hot. The compounds on the other hand, are mediocre. The v36 is the best compound/polish that CG offers. V32,V34, and V38 are all pretty bad. It removed no swirls or scratches. The Hex logic pads are great and overall I give it a 4 star. For the price, I’m not sure there’s anything better. With that being said, I do not have the most extensive paint correcting experience.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I received my package and immediately noticed a blue/green wet spot on the corner. I brought it inside and thats when I smelled it. I knew what had happened. So I open the box and sure enough, one of the bottles had been crushed and leaked onto everything else that was in there. The polisher itself wasn't damaged thankfully. Still haven't heard back about replacement/credit/refund. 👎
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Nicholas Gafford

customer_reviews.title: Still amazed after 5th car
customer_reviews.text: I have been detailing cars for many years and had heard of the system and finally bought it. It is flawless no swirls or holograms effects and I use Collinite insulator wax #845 afterwards for protection Thank you chemical guys for making my job easier and making it look like better than a new paint job. I’ve never seen anything like this I’m still amazed by the fifth car. I totally recommend this system
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Machine didn’t last two cars.
customer_reviews.text: While I loved the polishing package this has offered I was very dissapointed this polisher didn’t last two full car polishing. It went dead while I was doing my second car. Now I have to buy another DA polisher which cost me fair amount. Maybe I would’ve saved more money If I had brought my car to the detailer. By looking at the reviews, looks like there are many people with same issues. I would recommend you buy the 32~38 polishing bottles separately and buy different brand DA polisher. This is just too ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Kit includes everything
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The kit comes with everything needed; polishing creams & buffing pads. I'd never used one of these before but the instructions were easy to follow & understand. Quality seems good, only time will tell. It's not as heavy as I thought. Looked at a few sold locally before searching online & it's not as heavy as a few I checked out. It is on the expensive side. However, because it's lightweight & kit included everything it was worth the few extra dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeweli

customer_reviews.title: First time polishing
customer_reviews.text: The polisher doesn't have much vibration so you don't feel like your arms are going to fall off when you're using it. It is a little heavy so doing the roof of a vehicle can be cumbersome but I have to assume that's pretty normal for the type of machine. I'm satisfied with my purchase and am glad I bought it. I used it for a polish and a coat of wax. Excited to be able to use it again in the future
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Isringhausen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Polisher Kit. I liked the selection of accessories and samples that came with the kit.
customer_reviews.text: This Polisher feels very solid and the speed adjustment is very smooth. It's random orbital gear works very, making sure the head is always moving, helping to prevent paint warm-up and swirls. It came with three pads, all a different color, which I liked, unfortunately, when washed, the color disappeared, making it hard to figure out which pad is which. They are all Dark Grey now (-1 Star) I would have expected the coloration to be permanent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pack a sandwich...
customer_reviews.text: I guess don’t read the directions on the compounds they offer and use with the videos. The videos say turn the buffer to level 6, but if you get the specs from the manufacture, the speeds are total opposites. The compound says go slow~1200rpm~, but apparently the lowest speed on the buffer is around 2400 rpm? And the guy on the video is like crank it up to 6 ~7400rpm~... so far it’s helped take out some swirl marks but no scratches at all, and just put more finer swirl marks. The SS compound they show in the videos, with this buffer and pads, is doubtful, but I’m going to keep trying at it with their other products.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great Polisher
customer_reviews.text: Great polisher! A little heavy for vertical jobs like car doors but nice weight for the top of cars since you do not need to add much extra pressure. When you do add pressure the polisher doesn’t not slow muchbif at all. The pads are above average. It is not clear what the liquids are exactly. I did not use them. Two very small issues which prevent a 5 star rating. The power switch is at the end of the handle which seems awkward to turn off when you are holding other parts of the handle. Also the speed dial is VERY VERY easy to accidentally grab and dial up or down. Again small issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cav Scout

customer_reviews.title: This would be a good buffer BUT...
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good buffer BUT... The ergonomics are terrible, and the speed controller is is a terrible place, making SURE that every time you pick it up and use it, you will bump the wheel. The cord is far too stiff and should have more silicon content as well. All other things aside, it does a good job, but it's extremely heavy, clumsy, and the controls stink.
customer_reviews.author: V. Richie

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job only thing i personally dont like is that there is a power switch instead of a trigger but it is a great DA polisher it is so hard to mess up a detail with this! UPDATE: JUST BUY A RUPES this is so loud and it vibrates so much compared to a quality da the lhr15 mk2 gives you a better user experience the torx made my hand fall asleep and go numb after 1 hour
customer_reviews.author: The detailer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing first time results
customer_reviews.text: Best money I've spent in a while. Watched a few instructional videos online and had the paint on my 20yr old Jeep starting to look like new within an hour. Scratches, swirls, rub spots and fog are gone. Maybe a bit heavy but not unwieldy. Gets quite warm during extended use but that's not surprising. Enough polishes for one car, give or take. I also bought the 3" backing plate and pads for smaller areas. I'd recommend this kit in a heartbeat. No regrets whatsoever and I am very happy with the results so far.
customer_reviews.author: khornet

customer_reviews.title: pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.text: i disliked that it wasn't complete as advertised. Was missing the 3 big microfiber towels its suppose to come with and the cleaner bottle it comes with was also cracked so it leaked all over the insides of my box and was missing a lot of it from it leaking. !! other then those things everything else worked great !! used it on some chemical guys scratch and swirl remover after washing it with some Mr Pink, and clay baring it. worked pretty good left a nice polish too. did not use it very long either goes right to work !!!
customer_reviews.author: v8 300c

customer_reviews.title: I did 2 cars and it worked great. Only complaint is the speed control is easy ...
customer_reviews.text: My first professional style polisher after decades of using the hand buffers. I'm impressed! I did 2 cars and it worked great. Only complaint is the speed control is easy to accidently change. I like the fine adjustment but notches could help hold it in place. I'm looking forward to using this in the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: gcphost

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been detailing cars for a long time.. I have a black ram 1500 and this tool keeps it shining like the day it was made... great for removing light scratches and swirls, great for polishing and applying wax.. oh and it'll never put a swirl in the paint! I'd buy another one if it ever quit working!!
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with this little buffer, I had a Dewalt with 8” pads but it is heavy large and difficult to use in the detail areas on some Hot Rods. This buffer is built very well and light in comparison to others in its class. I love the on and off switch in the back which frees you from holding in a trigger, the soft start is a nice feature also. The only negatives I wish the dial for the speed selection was recessed it’s easy to bump while using, also the unit came with a spare set of brushes which were broken when it arrived. Overall I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Leonberger

customer_reviews.title: Very good polisher
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant dropping so much money on a polisher, but I know you get what you pay for. The polisher is pretty loud at full tilt, but still very easy to use and manage. Overall, the polisher has a nice heft and solid feel to it. The pads are good quality, and I will probably buy spares down the road.
customer_reviews.author: schan

customer_reviews.title: Broken at 10 uses or less...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in April and we used it once or twice a month since then. It just broke on us today, 8 months later. The c-clip detached from the spindle, causing the spindle and the pad disk to separate from rest of the wand. It will still spin if we stick the spindle back in and hold it against the car but it seems pretty dangerous as there is nothing keeping the attachment... attached. Maximum of 10 uses does not seem appropriate for the amount of money we spent. I don't see an option to contact the seller so I am leaving this review.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Willing

customer_reviews.title: POLISH & WAX LIKE A PRO
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a used Acura TL. I took the car home, washed it, clay barred the entire car, polished, and waxed it using my new TORQX. I went back to dealership to pick up my plates and the salesperson had no idea it was the same car. The right tools make everything easy, and the TORQX makes polishing and waxing your car effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Feedbacker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner car retailers.
customer_reviews.text: As with everything Chemical Guys produce this is a great product. The only problem I have is the position of the speed control. It’s very easy to hit while using and increase or decrease the speed of the unit while buffing. With time and practice I was able to learn where to place and hold my hands. I really enjoy all of the training videos you can find on their website and YouTube to teach how to correctly use the buffer and the speeds needed for each step of the detaining process. Sure there are better orbital buffers out there but for the most part this one is just as good as anything else available, the price is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid polisher/power button is not very ergonomically located
customer_reviews.text: It's a very solid piece of equipment. My only complaint would be where the power button is located. It's difficult to fumble and find it when you want to turn it off. I also did not care for the samples of polish that were included. There is absolutely zero indication of what each bottle's purpose is intended.
customer_reviews.author: B5HARP

customer_reviews.title: Buy the one with handles
customer_reviews.text: I was using a rotary polisher before I got a D.A. Polisher the D.A. Doesn’t leave any swirling on the paint and is really great for using to apply wax. If you are going to use it a lot I would spend the extra money and get the next model up that has the handle on the bottom and top. It works great but would be better with the handles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than anything one can get at a local(non detail specialist) retail shop.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Did a paint restoration, to the best of my abilities, and the buffer didn't get too hot during the long session. pads are nicely made and resilient to soaking up too much product and getting to malleable. The towels are nothing special, but the pads and cleaner/conditioner make this a great value.
customer_reviews.author: hugo

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! Had a lot of light scratches and slight oxidation and after a few passes with the medium duty pad and 32 polish it was gone. Did a finishing pass with the black pad and 38 polish and ended up with a nice high gloss shine. Not bad for a 2013 truck that has lived in the Arizona sun.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kobylarek

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing! High quality tool, I have been detailing all my cars since I got it, I just wish the samples that came with the tool were bigger, as I used up most of the product on the 1st car I detailed & need to order more, I have been using left over product from another high quality Co. that I had laying around the garage before I purchased the orbital polisher. Thank you Chemical Guys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete kit but no polish compound added.
customer_reviews.text: Cool set up but it does not include any polishing or buffing compound, the 2 bottles are simply buffing pad cleaner. For something that's $200 I think there should be some compound added. The photo is everything in the box
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY FOR PAINT CORRECTION Operates fine but it vibrates more than any other buffer I've used and this will not take out even light scratches. I tried their hardest pad and cutting compound and it wouldn't remove even light scratches or swirling. As a polisher though it works as well as any other on Amazon. Got tired of using my friend's buffer and bought this because I've had great results from chemical guys products in the past and thought this would be a great deal like the rest of their stuff but this thing just doesn't work, even if I go super slow on the heaviest compound/pad combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Torqx is a quality product that works well for what i need it for. Compound, polish, and wax. Comes with everything you need to get started with a polisher/buffer tool except polishes, waxes, ect. Quality microfiber towels included leave no lint behind.
customer_reviews.author: Collins10111

customer_reviews.title: Good Consumer Detailer
customer_reviews.text: I'm far from a pro detailer but we've used this for overall paint correction on three cars and, some work minimizing scratches here and there, and cleaning up some old headlights. I don't have a lot of experience with other devices in this class to compare it to but it has done everything we needed it to brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: shipped exactly as expected, arrived sooner than expected and performed better than expected . Very light and easy to use. Only one small down side, the speed adjuster is right on the handle and i kept hitting it and changing speeds but i would buy this again. Just need to get some more product . Great product.. Thank you !!!
customer_reviews.author: AdaptiveSoul

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WORKED 4 TIMES
customer_reviews.text: Your better off buying something else, used for times and quite working right in the middle of my buffing car, does not stand up buy a DeWalt or other brand and get good quality, spoke with Torq was referred to chemical guys, was told I would get e-mail to send unit back and receive another, got no e-mail and no further contact with anyone, Amazon needs to stop selling these they don't hold up to even occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great polisher for the DIYer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit for the money. I detail my own cars and help family members with theirs so it gets a decent amount of use. I'm not sure how it'd stand up to daily use by a professional detailer but for personal use its great. Came with lots of pads for every type of polish and sealer. cleaner and lube also worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and good making
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my husbands birthday and it’s one of the best gifts. He needed a good quality to maintain our cars. After a few researching I came across this set. It was a wise choice because this is a heavy duty. The chemical guys does wonders. The set is definetly worth it because it’s expensive to buy individual bottles.
customer_reviews.author: elisha

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I got it to perform light polishing and to speed up wax and sealent applications. Pros: time saver, good build quality, middle noise level, and powerful. The pads are excellent too Cons: none yet for my application Recommended for light to middle size tasks
customer_reviews.author: Pancake Robot

customer_reviews.title: Starting my new detail shop
customer_reviews.text: I love these guys. Learning a lot from their YouTube videos. Love the products and can’t wait for all my stuff to come in. I have a boat coming as my first detail customer and several vehicles on stand by. I’m ready for this new experience. I’ve always loved detailing my cars, but it’s time to step it up. Thanks Chemical Guys for the great tutorials.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Elias

customer_reviews.title: No torq
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to it's name, it has no "torq". This thing can't even turn under it's own weight. That makes it hard to do any corrections of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great... for 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t my first orbital polisher, so - I know a thing or two about them. This worked GREAT... for 45 minutes. After that, even with just the pressure from the weight of the machine - it stopped spinning. I’ll be returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Lovely product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My bike had some 3m stuck on the tank for a long time and it made the paint not shiny. I got this and put of the product on in stages and it now looks so much better. It's a lot more shiny. I'll eventually use it on my car next.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Mock

customer_reviews.title: Very good value.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. The pads are surprisingly durable. The compounds are small, 1 is not enough to do a whole car.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the results. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the results. Easy to use. My only issue is that the placement of the on-and-off switch is in a terrible location. I don’t think I would buy this again and opt for a different one with a better situated on-and-off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Leash

customer_reviews.title: Great product and set
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing buffer and combo pack! It has everything you need to get going. The pads are easy to install and you get your basic ones to accomplish most projects. Everything was in new unaltered condition despite what some of the other reviews have stated. I highly recommend this set to do everything from refinishing the gel coat on a boat to removing scratches and swirls on your car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety Concern - Lasted 3 Car polishes
customer_reviews.text: Used the polisher three times. On the third polish there was a load bang in the front section of the polisher. Bits came flying out and there was a grinding sound. I wouldn't accept a replacement if offered.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great polisher, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a DA buffer because I didn’t want to burn through my paint. I received the buffer and it seemed well built. I have since polished 3 cars. It works great and is super easy to use. The polish that came with it is amazing. I could not be happier with my purchase. Great value for the money. It makes your car look amazing
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: polisher died after about 6 time use.
customer_reviews.text: The polisher is poor quality. It died after about 5-6 time use. I was polishing a car an all of a sudden sparks came out and the thing was dead. It was well taken care of. Rest of the kit is decent but the polisher just ruined it.
customer_reviews.author: Jibran Tahirkheli

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Ok so after I try the kit I can tell you guys. It’s the best kit that I ever used. I have a black Mercedes I start with clay bar and then orenge ped with v 34 compound and then White ped with v38 polish and the car like brand new highly recommended. I followed the videos at you tube . Thank you !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oshri

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: small, so it is alot easier to use and can get into the harder angle areas that a 10inch orbital buffer cant. Also speed controls make it for a perfect for almost any job other than high speed buffing you would do with a wool pad.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner who learned how to use this product off YouTub. I had some swirls and marring from clay bar, this baby easily removed it with some scratch removal product. Can’t wait to use her again for polish and wax.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Frish

customer_reviews.title: Met Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in good shape and works to my expectations. The buffing pads work well. I find it most useful in applying finishing wax. It makes waxing the cars much easier than doing it by hand application.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I watched some of the YouTube videos and after doing 2 cars I haven’t had any issues. You can’t mess this up. Pads stay on, polish works great, it gets a little hot on the machine where the head meets the body so watch out. Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Good Results, But Issues With the Polisher.
customer_reviews.text: The results are great. However, my polisher was defective. I was only able to do about two thirds of my car since the machine would turn on and off randomly. On the bright side, Amazon was amazing and sent a replacement right away.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty good for a short while. Quit in the middle of a big job.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for just under a year, but failed in the middle of a really big job. Should have spent my money elsewhere the first time around. Maybe thirty hours of total use? Total rubbish. And the speed dial is located in a spot where it's easy to accidentally change the speed. Very expensive paperweight is what I've got now. No word on any warranty.
customer_reviews.author: CyborgX

customer_reviews.title: Part 1-stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit 13 months ago. Everything worked well and I was very pleased with it at that time. I took it out this week for its 2nd use, and it did not work, it just made a low grinding noise. At this time I will be contacting customer service to see what I can do
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work

product_meta.title: Chemical Guys BUF_503X TORQX Random Polisher Kit with Pads, Polishes & Compounds (9 Items)
product_meta.description:
Style:BUF_503X Kit

TORQ Tools set out to develop an auto detailing tool that anyone can use, enjoy, and afford. The TORQX Random Orbital Polisher is the machine for the enthusiast detailer and weekend warrior who wants one machine to do it all. With the TORQX, anyone can polish paint, remove swirls and scratches, spread wax and sealant, scrub carpet, clean and restore clarity to headlights, and more. TORQ engineers designed the TORQX with simple and intuitive controls, rugged components, and durable build materials to last for years of dependable detailing use. The powerful 680 watt motor of the TORQX delivers the power and torque needed and demanded by enthusiasts and professionals alike. The TORQX uses the same gentle dual action motion and 8mm throw that enthusiasts and professional detailers know and trust even on the most sensitive or durable paint finishes. The TORQX is the powerful machine that won't bog down on any polishing, waxing, or hardcore cleaning job on any vehicle. Easily polish single stage, clear coat, or new ceramic clear coat paint finishes, polished metals, glass, and clear optical plastics with the TORQX. The tight form factor and precision balance of the TORQX fits comfortably in the hand and is perfect for any detailing situation. Use the TORQX to comfortably polish cars, trucks, large RV or trailer sidewalls, boat and airplanes, and any other automotive surface without strain or fatigue. The TORQX is the machine of choice for any beginner, hardcore enthusiast, or professional detailer looking for one simple, lightweight, and powerful machine that can do it all. Tackle any detailing task with the TORQX.

How To Use It:
1) Shake well and apply 4-5 drops of V36 to Orange Pad.
2) Prime pad with Pad Conditioner.
3) Dab product out evenly across 2' x 2' section.
4) Turn on machine on surface to speed setting 1 to spread product.
5) Increase speed to 5-6 and using moderate pressure.
6) Work area in 2-3 passes until product becomes clear.
7) Examine results. If you are satisfied with results, proceed to step 10.
8) If you are not satisfied with results, try using V34 with the Orange Pad; if you are satisfied, proceed to step 10.
9) If an even more aggressive approach is needed, switch to the Yellow Cutting Pad.
10) Refine finish with white pad and V38 Final Polish.
11) Work until optical clarity is achieved.
12) Remove residue with clean microfiber towel.
